snippet: Findings from NASA’s Mars rover show that the planet may have once been warm and wet and a pleasant place where microbes could have thrived.
abstract: NASA scientists, reporting on latest findings from Mars rover, say several billion years ago the planet may have been pleasant place for tiny microbes to live, with plenty of water as well as minerals that could have served as food; say they have yet to find signs that actual microbes did live in that oasis.
lead_paragraph: Findings from NASA’s Mars rover show that the planet may have once been warm and wet and a pleasant place where microbes could have thrived.

headline.seo: Mars Could Have Supported Life, NASA Says
headline.main: Mars Could Have Supported Life Long Ago, NASA Says
headline.print_headline: Mars Could Have Supported Life Long Ago, NASA Says
